qas.question: What was the first non-Pixar movie to win the Best Animated Feature Film award?

answers.text: The Adventures of Tintin: The Secret of the Unicorn

qas.question: Where did Adventures of Tintin debut?
When did Adventures of Tintin debut?

How much did Adventures of Tintin earn?

How much did The Adventures of Tintin: The Secret of the Unicorn make in the United States?

When was it announced that Peter Jackson would direct the next The Adventures of Tintin movie?
What will be the name of the next Tintin movie?

context: In early 2009, Spielberg shot the first film in a planned trilogy of motion capture films based on The Adventures of Tintin, written by Belgian artist Hergé, with Peter Jackson. <a0_0>The Adventures of Tintin: <b9_0>The Secret of the Unicorn<b9_0/><a0_0/>, was not released until October 2011, due to the complexity of the computer animation involved. The world premiere took place on <a2_0>October 22, 2011<a2_0/> in <a1_0><b5_0>Brussels, Belgium<b5_0/><a1_0/>. The film was released in North American theaters on <a3_0>December 21, <b8_0>2011<b8_0/><a3_0/>, in Digital 3D and IMAX. It received generally positive reviews from critics, and grossed <a4_0>over <b6_0><b7_0>$373 million<b7_0/><b6_0/> worldwide<a4_0/>. The Adventures of Tintin won the award for Best Animated Feature Film at the Golden Globe Awards that year. It is the first non-Pixar film to win the award since the category was first introduced. Jackson has been announced to direct the second film.
